reviews.review: Great game would be 9/10 except for the killer 'Plague,' This killer is the most disturbing addition to the  entire gaming industry.Who thought it was good idea to have all the survivors get puked on by a old lady dressed like budget Cleopatra. From the survivors point of view, they see their beloved character puke and vomit every where like an indigenous rabbit. Really makes me question the mental instability of the developers. Like how deeply disturbed do you have to be to create that abomination. The person who came up with this concept must have been abused or molested, because no one can create that freak without having been beaten severely and deprived of a normal childhood. I would bet the creator of the plague tortures kittens and puppies in their sleep. Honestly I would rather stick needles in my eyes and suck an old mans dic*k than play against that abomination.  I always ensure I give feedback that is constructive so a way to improve this disaster. Firstly remove the developer who created the plague and start doing background checks on developers to see if anyone has been abused.

VARY GOOD COMRADE 
        
      VARY GOOD

The main concept of the game is awesome, it has a uniq experience, and kinda addictive in long term, really good aspect in general. But there are 3 problems

1. Toxicity. Being able to handle bad behaviour is not equal with enjoying the game and if you're not ready for this i would not recommend for you to play as killer at all. If only you would encounter toxic people a few games, but after a lot of hours i can say toxicity is present in almost EVERY game so be ready for that if you choose the killer role.

2. The game is unbalanced on both sides. There are certain killers who are way more overpowered unlike others. If the player is good, literally leaving the survivors almost no chance to win at all. Good example is Nurse, who has an ability which allows her to complety ignore most of the elements of this game. Against other killers however the survivor perks are superior. On higher ranks you will realize sooner or later that as a killer you rely on the mistakes survivors make. If you the make, you'll have a chance to win, if they don't you have no chance. If you're playing a weak killer, one survivor can literally stall the game from the start till the end by looping around you pallets and other objects.

3. Bunch of bugs, exploits which are present for years without being fixed.

4. Report system is only a "decoration". You can report or being reported for any or no viable reason at all, which makes me assume there's no way someone actually gets punished by that. If I'm wrong, innocent people can be baned for the mentioned reason above.

5. Point and emblem system is not fair. There is a chance a killer gets the most points without actually killing someone meanwhile you can be a survivor who succesfully fixed all five generators but you still didn't piped because you didn't saved anyone from the hook, or you wasn't being chased.

6. Outdated perks and addons are not being reworked or updated.

7. Lagswitch seems like a never punished commonly used cheating by many killers. There's no detection and unless someone is a youtuber/streamer with video proof, noone can prove it.

Overall it's an awesome game with great potential, but noone cares about the points I mentioned, at least not those who would be competent to make any real change in the game.

サバイバーをやるならおすすめ
キラーをやるならおすすめしない
そんなゲームです

まず第一に、個人的にはどのゲームよりも民度が低いです、それもサバイバーが圧倒的に。ゲーセンのガン○ムより酷いんじゃないかと思います。
キラー1人対サバイバー4人のデザインなのに現環境はサバイバー側が圧倒的に有利です。
ゲームシステムは他の人がたくさん書いてくれているので省略しますが、鬼ごっこと銘打ってはいるものの、キラーはサバイバーがミスをしないと勝てないような調整がされています。
同じ腕前ではキラーは絶対と言ってよいほど勝てません。まぁ明確な勝敗条件などはないので何を勝ち負けとするかは人次第ではありますが。

私はキラーメインでプレイしていますが、正直心が折れそうになったことが何度もあります、というか折れてしばらくやらなくなることもあります。
サバイバーの脱出条件である発電機の修理が尋常じゃないほど早く、代表的な遅延パークである「破滅」というパークを装備しないと相当キツいです。しかしそのパークはサバイバーから破壊することが可能です。運が悪ければサバイバーの初期地点の真横にあるなんてこともざらです。
サバイバーは合計16個のパークをつけているにも関わらずキラーはパーク4つ、そしてそのひとつを「破滅」で使用していて開幕破壊されれば実質パーク3つで勝負することになります。
それだけならまだしもサバイバーはキラーにダウンさせられ担がれたあと、「決死の一撃」というパークでキラーから逃れることが可能。そしてキラーにスタンのおまけつき。現状ほとんどの生存者がこの「決死の一撃」をつけています。明らかにバランスがおかしいです。
そして人数を減らすことに大きな意味があるのでキラーは1度吊ったサバイバーを救助されずにそのまま退場させたくなります、いわゆる「キャンプ」と呼ばれる行為です。サバイバーには好まれませんが運営はこれを戦術のひとつとしています。加えてキラーのパークにこれを助長させるようなパークがあります。
にも関わらず運営はサバイバー側にこの「キャンプ」を打破することができるパーク「与えられた猶予」を実装しました。キラーが近くにいるときに吊られている生存者を救助するとキラーからの攻撃に耐えることができます。
後からダメージを受けるので使い手次第で効果があるか変わりますが。
そしてサバイバーは基本的にダメージを受けると自己回復することはできません。他のサバイバーに治療してもらうか、アイテムである「救急キット」を使用する必要があります。しかしサバイバー側の使用できるキャラクターの中に自己回復することができるようになるパーク「セルフケア」を持つキャラクターがいます。
キラーサバイバーを問わず全キャラクターは一定のレベルを上げると他のキャラクターでも使用できるようになります。
加えて数秒キラーよりも速く走ることができる「スプリントバースト」というパークを持つキャラクターもいます

大抵の生存者は上記した「決死の一撃」、「与えられた猶予」、「セルフケア」、「スプリントバースト」を装備しています。

キラーがようやく捕まえたサバイバー
が「決死の一撃」で脱出され「スプリントバースト」で遠くへ逃げる、「決死の一撃」が失敗してフックに吊るすことができても「与えられた猶予」でキラーの攻撃に耐え「スプリントバースト」で遠くへ逃げ安全なところで「セルフケア」で回復する。
大抵この流れになります。
何をどうとらえてもキラーが不利過ぎます。キラーの中にはサバイバーを一撃でダウンさせる攻撃手段を持つキャラクターもいますが、「与えられた猶予」はこの一撃攻撃すらも耐えることができます。

極めつけはサバイバーのアイテム「工具箱」によるフックの破壊です。サバイバーはキラーがサバイバーを吊るすための「フック」を「工具箱」もしくは「サボタージュ」というパークを用いて破壊することができます。
しかもこれはゲージを寸止めさせておき、キラーが担いでもうすぐフックに吊るせるという状況で目の前で破壊することができます。
キラーは別のフックを探す他無く、近くにフックが無ければその間にサバイバーはキラーからもがき脱出することが可能です。

ここまで書いてきたようにキラーが不遇過ぎます。
そして何よりも、このゲームの運営はサバイバー側に有利な調整ばかりしてきます。
前述したキャンプに対抗する「与えられた猶予」もそのひとつです。
サバイバーがキラーに捕まらないようにする手段としてパレットや窓枠といったものがあります、サバイバーはこの2つをグルグルすることで時間を稼ぎます、通称「板グル」、「窓グル」と言われるものです。
現状このグルポイントが非常に多いです。
キラーからの苦情が多く運営は1度このグルポイントを少なくしました。しかし、のちに告知なくこのグルポイントを元に戻したのです。それだけでなく増やすという愚行まで行いました。

このようにサバイバー有利な環境を運営はさらにサバイバー有利な調整を行います。キラーが有利になるような調整はほとんどされません。

そして、大抵のサバイバーは脱出手前の安全なところでキラーを煽りに煽ってきます。
高速屈伸やライト連打、ゲーム後もリザルトのチャット機能で「ez」や「noob」など。鋼の心を持っていないとキラーは続けられません。

最初に述べた「サバイバーをやるならおすすめ、キラーをやるならおすすめしない」というのはここまで述べてきたものがあるからです。

動画などを見て「楽しそうだな、面白そうだな」と思った方、他の方のレビューも合わせてご覧いただき、ご一考ください。

Я блять понимаю что разрабы не имеют отношение к РКН(храни их JESUS), но из-за ,,топовых,, вылетов игра говно))000)))000.Токсичные игроки, баланс(которого нет), лаги , А ЕЩЁ ЕБУЧИЙ РКН, в этой игре даже читеры со спидхаком и хернёй когда они в шкавчиках сидят ,а ман взять их не может(ахуеть просто)>.<

El juego es divertido y entretenido (incluso adictivo) aunque su jugabilidad sea repetitiva, el problema es que por 3 motivos es injugable. 

El primero es la falta de servidores locales, lo cual aumenta las posibilidades de que te toque una partida con lag o incluso con muy mala suerte una en la que en lugar de ser 4 supervivientes seáis 3 (y el asesino os matara igualmente). 

El segundo es el desbalanceo, tanto si juegas como superviviente o asesino te podrá tocar un equipos muy buenos o muy malos y el matchmaking no parece ayudar mucho porque parece no tener en cuenta las horas que tiene cada jugador.

El tercero, pero no por ello menos importante es la comunidad toxica de este juego. 

Jugando como asesino te puedes encontrar con supervivientes que abusan de algunos objetos como la caja de herramientas (sabotearte la mayoría de ganchos o trampas de osos) y linternas (cegarte cada vez que atrapas un superviviente no una vez sino durante toda la partida) o perks (tiempo prestado, golpe decisivo…). Los que opinan que hacer body block al asesino mientras lleva un superviviente es totalmente legal (opino que no lo es). Supervivientes que cuando los persigues solo saben darte vueltas infinitas alrededor de los pallets para luego tirártelos.

Jugando como superviviente te puedes encontrar con asesinos campers, focusers, tunnelers y en algunos casos extraño chetos. 

No menciono los bugs del juego porque los desarrolladores intenta arreglarlos con los parches  sacan de vez en cuando (eso si arreglan unas cosas joden otras XD) y dentro de lo que cabe son molestos pero la mayoría no te impiden jugar.

Termino diciendo que no recomiendo para nada comprar este juego, salvo si quieres que te salga un cáncer en el cerebro de todas las veces que te enfadaras. Te lo dice un jugador que ha malgastado más de 1,000 horas en este juego. La probabilidad de que juegues una buena partida, independientemente de si ganas o pierdes, es de un 5% en comparación con el 95% de probabilidad de que te toque una mala partida.
the amount of hours you get for the price is crazy, one of the best games i have played, i love the grind.  highly recommend.

Recomendado a medias, porque mas alla de que la jugabilidad es por veces complicada, es un juego divertido.
Ahora no hay o es minimo el balance a la hora de emparejar, ni decir lo complicado que es conseguir entrar a una partida con buen PING. Muchas DLC que agregan personajes pero no arreglan BUG del juego.
Cuando inicias una partida con tus amigos, primero entras a una sala, despues tenes que consegui OTRA sala con buen ping y si salis de la sala por ping alto, tenes que volver a crear la primer sala con tus amigos, las primeras veces no hay problema y tampoco habria problema si se consiguen salas con un buen ping, pero como esto no es asi es bastante frustrante, crear la sala, invitar, entrar a otra sala, salir y volver a repetir los mismos pasos.
El soporte del juego en algunos casos se lavan las manos mandandote a leer foros en ingles, son muy pocas las ayudas en idoma español, Multilenguaje en foros! no seamos cerrados.

This game is a serious mixed bag, but if asked, I'd definitely have to say I land on the side of reccomending it. I have a soft spot for several things in games, balanced Asymmetrical multiplayer is definitely one of them.

Anyways, down to the review. 

[h1]What's great:[/h1]

There is a wide selection of characters to play as, both for killers and survivors. Each survivor and killer starts off with three perks that are completely unique to them. In survivors, there's Dwight whose pers are all about teamplay, giving his allies bonuses to actions just by being near them. Meg who is all about being fast and holding the killer's attention until she can lose them. David King is essentially about being the stereotypical grizzled tough guy, going so far as to have a perk that makes him permanently wounded but also capable of getting himself back into the action without help.

There are more survivors, of course, but let's talk about some killers. The Hillbilly is a chainsaw wielding killer who has the ability to mad dash across the map and instantly kick a survivor down, at the cost of having an awful turn radius and getting stunned if he bumps into something. The Nurse is essentially a floating ghost capable of teleportation across medium distances and striking from nowhere, at the cost of being rendered completely useless for a few seconds after teleporting. A personal favorite of mine is the Shape, AKA Mike Meyers, whose entire point is that he's all about creepily staring at people from a distance in order to get more powerful. Yup, this game has [b]licensed characters[/b], and from what I've been told, they do a decent job of capturing the feel of a lot of them. Mikey even has completely unique music for pretty much all of his actions.

Each of these characters, both survivors and killers are fairly customizable, with each survivor being able to bring in (or find mid-match) various tools to help them survive, such as medkits for helping themselves and other survivors and toolboxes to help them escape faster. Killers have their own version of this which are unique to each killer. For instance, the Hillbilly can get some addons that allow him to counteract his weakness a bit and let him turn a bit sharper. The Doctor has some of my favorite addons. The Doctor is a killer based around essentially screwing with the survivors and warping their game experience. His addons tend to radically change how he plays, making it so survivors see phantom copies of the killer, see safe havens that aren't real. Just cool stuff, really. Now if these seem overpowered, read on (it's not).

The most unique thing I can think of about this game is the level-up system. See, as you complete matches, you're ranked on several different factors. Did you help out with the overall objective of escaping? Did you help your fellow survivors or leave them to die? Were you good at evading the killer and getting things done in dangerous situations? All of these kinds of things affect how many Bloodpoints you get at the end of the match. These bloodpoints are essentially a pool of experience points that work for every character, survivor and killer. You spend these points on the bloodweb, which is a randomly generated web of items, perks and offerings unique to each character. When you complete a bloodweb for a character, the character levels up and you're provided with a new random web with a new set of things to go through. Once a character has been leveled up enough, you start having to make choices about what items you want and which items you're okay with not getting, as the game will start locking them ouf of that web if you claim too many items without grabbing them.

I'm almost done with the good parts, I promise. This is me tying it all together. Each character has three unique perks, right? So as you level them up, you can eventually get Teachable versions of their perks, which allow a character's perks to show up in other character's bloodwebs. So say you like how a character plays, but you think they'd be a lot better if you could use perks that another character has, like maybe you want Dwight to be able to periodically sprint off rocket like Meg can. You can keep playing Dwight and use the points to level Meg instead so you can access her perk sooner. Hell, you can even level killers from playing as a survivor and vice versa, it's great! You can play the game however you want and choose how you get rewarded.

[h1]The Bad[/h1] (AKA why I said [b/]Mixed Bag[/b]):

Other shoe dropping. Honestly, the biggest problem with this game is toxicity in my opinion. I was going to try to find some cheeky humorous way to drop this reveal, but screw it: Survivors a freakin terrible people. I understand completely why some eldritch god is imprisoning these people with an unstoppable murderer hell-bent on ending their lives slowly and painfully. There are a fair number of perks usable by survivors that tend to encourage completely anti-thematic gameplay and, ironically, make killers feel hopeless. Currently (though being patched quite soon) there's a survivor perk that encourages survivors to sit and heal themselves in front of the killer so they can stun the killer by dropping a box on them. There is literally nothing the killer can do to counteract this against an experienced survivor, it's either you let them heal or you get stunned, they run off while you can't see, then they continue healing.

Regularly, survivors will all have escaped. The objective for survivors is to fix generators scattered across the map and open big doors on the outskirts to leave through. More often than not, some survivor will just sit at one of the doors after everyone has escaped just to t-bag you like we're still playing an early Halo game.

Oddly enough, I've met a large number of really nice killers. Whenever a surivor disconnects on my team, there's a decent chance the killer will just start goofing around with the survivors and help them accomplish their goal faster.

The only other downside I can think of is just some other perk balance stuff, but that's constantly being looked at. Unfortunately, in the meantime, it has created several stigmas for me personally when playing a killer. There's a fair number of times I boot up a lobby, watch the survivors fill the game and just sigh. "Maybe I'll be wrong" I think. "Maybe those Claudettes won't be horribly dickish people." "Maybe they'll play honorably and not insult me non-stop if I dare to successfully outwit any of them." Alas, it is frequently not so.

All-in-all, the game doesn't get completely crushed by this factor. It's a genuinely enjoyable experience with a large number of playstyles to go about, a great variety of maps, tools, situations and a really fun time when playing in a group of friends.

缺点：

Oyun güzel buglar olabiliyor her oyunda olduğu gibi fakat tek kötü yanları oyunda istediğimiz mapı seçemiyoruz ve oyunun daha da geliştirilmesi gerek.
Вылетает при заходе в игру..
Игра превосходная! Смотрел долгое время стримы по игре и вот недавно решил приобрести! Игра оправдала мои ожидания!!!

Impossible à recommander. A jouer, oui. Mais pas à recommander ou évaluer positivement.
Ce qui fait l'originalité de Dead By Daylight, et par ailleurs son succès, c'est son concept. Je ne vais pas paraphraser le résumé du jeu fait par steam en guise de prextexte pour rédiger une évaluation positive, ou même négative, le résumé est juste en haut de la page.
Néanmoins, la seule force de Dead By Daylight, c'est son concept. Le reste est, malheuresement, terriblement mauvais.

Premièrement les bugs, exploits et cheats. Pendant près d'un an, le premier point, les bugs, étaient légion dans le jeu. Aujourd'hui ils se font beaucoup plus rares. Toutefois certains subsistent encore, plutôt sous la forme d'aspect visuel, ou encore peuvent être assimilés aux exploits. Eux en revanche sont nombreux. Et ils prennent diversent forme. Des survivants capablent de body-block des tueurs sur certaines maps sans que ce derniers puissent faire quoique ce soit (et je ne parle pas du [i]love train[/i]), le fameux usage du Pallet-Looping qui exploite une faille dans les hit-box survivants/tueurs/maps, les tueurs qui peuvent toucher par delà une fenêtre, ou lâcher un survivant pour 'cancel' une perk etc... Et enfin les cheats, qui deviennent de plus en plus courant en ce moment : notamment le lag switch et surtout les speed hacks assez présent ces derniers temps (environs 10 pour ma part la semaine du 4-10 Juin, surtout en high et middle ranks).
Deuxièment, et pas des moindres, et qui plus est un classique de nos jours, l'équilibrage. Or si il est parfois dur d'équilibrer un jeu, et qu'il y aura toujours des groupes pour se plaindre et se tirer la couverture, sur Dead By Daylight on atteint un sommet en revanche. Basiquement, le Tueur à un rôle réactif (déjà ça commence mal quand on y pense bien), ce qui fait qu'il repose sur les erreurs des survivants. Du coup, en low ranks (20-15 sur une échelle 20 à 1), le Tueur tend à être complétement fumé. En revanche au-delà, c'est le Tueur qui est une victime, et son objectif devient de survivre aux survivants... Concernant un set de perks, que chaque personnage peut équiper au nombre de quatre, c'est relativement simple. En tueur vous avez l'éternel et classique Chili & Barbecue, quoique pas toujours présent à 100%. Côté survivant depuis le rank 15, et en 50 heures de Jeu absolument tout survivants jouent au moins avec la perk Auto-Soin et Course Effrenée, quand c'est pas les deux en même temps ... Et chaque fois que je regarde en fin de partie, on a généralement 4 Auto-Soin et 3 Course Effrénée. Et ceci depuis 2 ans. Sans compter d'autre perks qui sont très ancrées comme le Coup Décisif et Drôlement Dur et... Euh bah c'est tout. Et moi qui me plaignait des longues métas Hearthstone... 
Enfin le Troisième point, et qui se trouve être intimement lié aux deux précédents ... L'équipe de Développeurs. Je pense qu'on peut difficilement faire pire, et surtout dans le cadre de leur actuelle notoriété. Après deux ans, je me rend compte que l'équipe de Développeurs reflète la toxicité de leur communauté, à la différence que les Développeurs ont quelques efforts de communication à faire... Et encore... Basiquement les Développeurs sont incapables de répondre à une question sérieuse de la part de la communauté sur certains problèmes majeurs, ou la plupart du temps se débarasse de la question/problème avec une réponse brève et sur un ton condescendant avec un air de suffisance. Par ailleurs cette même équipe ne fait pas la différence entre Equilibrage et Bugs... Puisqu'on rencontre souvent des bugs corrigés répertoriés dans la catégorie Equilibrage... Et ce n'est pas une question de point de vue, puisqu'eux même commencent par "Fixed an issue [...]". Toutefois, les survivants sont quand même un peu plus "chouchoutés", normal vu qu'ils représente dans un idéal équilibre à atteindre, 4/5ème de la population du jeu, ce qui est relativement un point positif, surtout si vous voulez jouer entre amis. Maintenant on revient à la toxicité de la communauté. Regardez juste les développeurs lors de Streams, conférences (Le fameux "I think we did a pretty good job so far" du Game Director il y a plus d'un an, alors que le jeu était truffés de bugs et au plus bas.) etc... La plupart du temps la toxicité vient surtout des survivants. Si il est dur de réfréner les comportements de chacun, et notamment les accusations sur le Chat de fin de partie, les développeurs peuvent en revanche faire quelque chose pour le Teabag (de la même manière que CS:GO le fait), les clicketis de lampes torches, les tentatives de griefing etc... Cependant, il est plus dur d'accabler le Tueur des mêmes maux ; certes le camping et le tunneling sont très frustant et j'aimerais au passage que les développeurs encourage autre chose, mais le spam de la cloche avec le Spectre qui était vu comme toxique et harcelant pour les survivants... Ben il a vite était corrigé. Au final on se retrouve avec un tas d'incohérences de la part des développeurs avec certainement le fait qu'ils se fichent de leur communauté une fois le jeu acheté. J'ai même l'impression qu'ils encouragent la toxicité de cette dernière. Justement, parlons des Déconnections (Abrégées DC et en excluant celle dans les lobby, donc une fois la partie lancée). Elles sont légions dans le jeu, et pour reprendre un joueur sur leurs forums ; "Il y règne une sorte d'anarchie". Il est pas rare de faire cinq parties d'affiliées avec une déconnection d'un survivant dès la première minute, ce qui généralement réduit à néant les chances des Survivants. Et ce ne sont pas de random déconnection dont je parle, mais très souvent des Survivants, toxiques là encore, qui parce que leur début de partie ne s'est pas très bien passé (je me fais attraper en 30sec au lieu de faire courrir le Tueur 3minutes) vont immédiatement déconnecter et sans craindre la moindre répercussion. Pourquoi ? Les Développeurs s'en fichent. Certains vont déconnecter juste en sachant à quel Tueur ils ont affaire (notamment le Docteur, et Freddy Krueger fût un temps). Les développeurs pourraient intégrer un système de cooldown progressif comme tous les jeux avec une équipe font. Mais non. Trop dur j'imagine. Par ailleurs, en Octobre 2017, beaucoup de gens, notamment low-rank, se plaignaient du Tueur Freddy, ce qui est légitime car bien que loin d'être le plus fort il demandait une adaptation plus exigeante que les autres. Du coup, il y avait énormément de DC. Qu'on fait les développeurs ? Ils ont nerf le Tueur pour pallier en partie aux problèmes de DC. Désolé ça ne marche pas comme ça, et encore aujourd'hui les déconnections sont nombreuses et impunies. Presque autant que le cheating, assez présent dans le jeu, car le système de report in-game est presque un leurre et que l'autre système de reports est bien trop difficile d'accès, pire que l'administration française.

Donc finalement, ce jeu est à mon sens impossible à recommander, bien qu'il reste jouable à petit dose par mois, et entre amis. Mais même là j'ai du mal, j'ai bien des amis qui ont explorés le jeu avec l'évènement du Nettoyage de Printemps, mais beaucoup ce sont juste fait martyrisés par les Survivants ou les Tueurs, ont eût une expérience désagréable et ont arrêtés, ou si ils ont continués, sont devenus quotidiennement rageux, salés ou toxiques eux mêmes.
Aussi vous l'aurez peut être plus ou moins devinez, mais si c'est le roleplay et l'immersion que vous cherchez... Passez votre chemin.

Seems like the game was built in mind for the survivors to not have comms. When they do. Game over. 

There's a good amount of killers but only about three of them can deal with the BS good survivors will put you through.

The balence of this  game is definetly out of wack. Most of my complaints about this game is about the killer role. I switch to survivor when I want to have a good time. Outside of a killer choosing to camp you. There's not too much they can do to ruin your time. Wheras a survivor can win and get the doors open. Then choose to waste your time staying in the level because they will not leave till you walk to the door and watch them teabag you.

I like the idea of the game. But its way too easy for the survivors to bully the killer and at that point the game feels like a joke.

Wer Horror liebt findet hier das was er schon immer gesucht hat, eine Flucht vor einem Killer mit unbekannter Spielweise. Es macht allein sowie in einer Gruppe enorm viel spaß und man steht selbst richtig unter Strom. 
Das einzige womit man klar kommen muss sind Camper Killer und Survivors die einfach alt f4 drücken und somit ihr Team im Stich lassen.
Dies ist ein Spiel wo man immer wieder üben muss bevor es genau so klappt wie man sich das vorstellt. 
Ist auf jedenfall sein Geld wert gewesen :)

Единственные минуса этой игры - это долгое ожидание в лобби за маньяка и ливеры. Можно поспать, поесть, посрать в конце концов, а игра так и не начнётся, в общем долгое ожидание начала игры за маньяка. Сурвы могут спокойно ливать и за это им ничего не будет, просто ранг игровой понизится и всё. Разбрабы я вас ПРОШУ сделайте хоть какую-нибудь систему банов за ливы, это ж играть невозможно. А так игра очень атмосферная, рекомендую!
Muito bom

这个游戏是我玩过最尊重中国玩家的游戏了，虽然这么久以来，基本每次改动都偏向屠夫玩家，不过目前改动越来越不近人情了，可能想鼓励屠夫玩家。看到有人对拔线的惩罚机制很不满意，我个人觉得已经OK了，拔线掉豆还算可以吧。从封窗等改动到现在又要改极限板还有地窖，真的心累，那以后人类玩家只能惨死咯。既然这样那能不能开发语音系统，不管开不开黑都可以沟通，屠夫就你强任你抢，这样也算平衡吧。不过关于皮肤的改动我喜欢，毕竟以后可能就是杀鸡暖暖了。

While I rly like the game and the character this game is suppost to respesent a survival horror game, Dead by Daylight is FAR FROM a survival horror game, Instead off trying to survive a terrifying killer, Here you loop the killer around some pallets and come some boxes And then Teabag him or her because you showed how easy it is to survive you ''Terrifying Killer'' Assides from that, killers have to put someone on meathooks, but before that they have to hit the person twice and then Pick em up, And then hope the Survivor does not have a overpowerd skill called Desisive Strike or if another survivor doesn't have a Flashlight you just have to tap into the killers direction and they are forced to drop the survivor, And if that doesn't work, just bodyblock the killer and make them do they job all over again and then teabag some more. All with all Survivor in this game is not that spectacular, just repair 5 generator pretty damn fast open the exit gate and leave. As a killer if you dare to take the job, Just try not to get agitated by how stressfull your job is, Unless you play Hillbilly, He is broken as all crap. Along that in this game people will rage at your profile just because you killed them or because you did your job as a killer, And if you let other survivors die because it is to dangerous for your own life, Expect also a massive rage comment, I find the game decant but the community in this game is pure cancer. It is actually worse then League Or Dota in my opinion. I suppose if anything you are forced to make your profile privvate or friends only to not come acress the salt and rage in this game. With that said, This game takes grinding to get certain Perks what is even more crappy in my personal opinion.

As a last thing said, If you wana play this game for fun with some friends, Expect to get yelled at because apperandly it is toxic, You heared me, it is Toxic to play a multiplayer game with your friends. Do you still get it ? Because I certainly don't. The fact you get yelled at no mather what side you play and no mather what you do is pathetic and it surely makes it that I wound NOT recommend this game purely because off 2 main reasons. 

1. Killer in this game is a joke all you need to do is run around the same pallet or loop for 5 minutes and the game is done be either all generators done or the killers ragequitting.
2. Survivors in this game are mostly cancer. Is just teamagging and bullying the killer along with that just overal toxic behavior and making you think you are playing with little kids.

Maybe if the community gets better this game gets a me a possivity line but for now, If you rahter have a fun play, Stay the hell avay from the toxic waste land.

This game is an absolute dissapointment aside from the textural work from the artists. There are so many bugs it's surpising anybody is actually still playing. Just to name a few highly questionable things...

-You can blink through a 6 foot rock as the Nurse, but not through a 3 foot tall drum. 
-Melee attacks from the Killer often connect with the model and fail to do any damage, while other swings don't connect even close to the model and damage still registers.
-Classic marginalized game mechanics with all of the leveling from blood trees and no sophisticated matchmaking system to even precisely organize players of similar exp level.
-Infinites
-Lots of unviable characters/perks

Dont buy this. i have 160 hours in the game and I think the game is decent. The game can be very stale very fast if you're not playing with friends. One game you'll get farmed and instantly killed. Another game you're facecamped, not that there's anything wrong with that but wheres the fun in being killed by your own teammates. 

PS. I'm unsure about the vadility of this but I've heard on multiple accounts that Dead By Daylight uses spyware (Red Shell).  the most annoying thing about this is there's no reason given for this. By launching the game for the first time, you "Agree" (or as most people do it, check agree and skip the paragraph).

https://www.reddit.com/r/Steam/comments/8pud8b/psa_red_shell_spyware_holy_potatoes_were_in_space/
https://redshell.io/gamers

EDIT: Redshell is no longer in the game
